meanings.definition: A small piece of cloth used for wiping the nose or face.
meanings.sent1: She always carries a handkerchief in her bag for when she has a runny nose.
meanings.sent2: He pulled out his handkerchief to dab at the tears on his cheeks.
meanings.sent3: The handkerchief danced in the wind as she waved it to cool herself down.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a colorful handkerchief, brightening up the room.
meanings.sent5: The handkerchief, soft and comforting, brought a sense of nostalgia.

meanings.definition: A square of fabric carried in a pocket for personal hygiene or decoration.
meanings.sent1: He tucked the handkerchief neatly into his suit pocket before heading out.
meanings.sent2: The handkerchief peeked out of his pocket, adding a touch of elegance to his outfit.
meanings.sent3: She pretended the handkerchief was a tiny flag, waving it proudly in the air.
meanings.sent4: The handkerchief, though small, held countless memories within its folds.
meanings.sent5: The embroidered handkerchief was a delicate masterpiece of craftsmanship.
